sentences.english: We should certainly get rid of the evil traditions and customs.
sentences.chinese: 我們理所當然地要革除惡俗陋習。

sentences.english: old allegations of forced overtime burbled back to life.
sentences.chinese: 強迫加班的古老惡俗又死灰復燃。

sentences.english: It's a hilarious mix of kitsch and modern wonder.
sentences.chinese: 這是惡俗與摩登令人捧腹的組合。

definition: billowing smoke (idiom)/foul atmosphere/(fig.) murky atmosphere/in a turmoil
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
to moan about imaginary illness/fussing like a hypochondriac/fig. sentimental nonsense
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
"sensational headline writers", people who write misleading titles in order to generate clicks from Internet users/clickbait
to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
to keep one's calm in the face of the unexpected/not to wonder at strange sights
